testHelp

Class CallableAssertion

  • Object
    • ExecutableAssertion
      • CallableAssertion

  • public class CallableAssertion
extends ExecutableAssertion
    Represents an assertion about a snippet of code (functional object that implements the standard Java Callable interface) that returns some value.

    Note that the snippet is evaluated once and the result (value or exception) saved.

    Author:
    ejewart

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class ExecutableAssertion

        exception, subjectDesc

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      (package private) void execute()
      Abstract method for executing the executable snippet, needs to be overridden in all derived classes.
      CallableAssertion returns(Object object)
      Verifies that the snippet of code returns an object equal to the specified one using the Object.equals method.
      CallableAssertion returnsExactly(Object object)
      Verifies that the snippet of code returned exactly the same object (using == not .equals).
      CallableAssertion returnsInstanceOf(Class<?> type)
      Verifies that a snippet of code returns the correct type of result.

    • Method Detail

      • returnsInstanceOf

        public CallableAssertion returnsInstanceOf(Class<?> type)
        Verifies that a snippet of code returns the correct type of result.

        Contrary to what the name suggests, the method tests for exact type and does not accept subtypes in the Class.isInstance or Class.isAssignableFrom

        Parameters:
        type - type that the return value of the call is expected to be an instance of
        Returns:
        this if the return value is of expected type
        Throws:
        AssertionError - if the return value is not of the expected type

      • returns

        public CallableAssertion returns(Object object)
        Verifies that the snippet of code returns an object equal to the specified one using the Object.equals method.
        Parameters:
        object - a value of type Object or class derived from Object that the return value of the call is expected to be equal to
        Returns:
        this if the return value is equal to the expected value
        Throws:
        AssertionError - if the return value is not equal to the expected value

      • returnsExactly

        public CallableAssertion returnsExactly(Object object)
        Verifies that the snippet of code returned exactly the same object (using == not .equals). (sameObjectAs might be a clearer name for the method.)
        Parameters:
        object - a value of type Object or class derived from Object that the return value of the call is expected to be the same object as
        Returns:
        this if the return value is not the same as the expected value
        Throws:
        AssertionError - if the return value is not the same as the expected value

      • execute

        void execute()
        Description copied from class: ExecutableAssertion
        Abstract method for executing the executable snippet, needs to be overridden in all derived classes. It doesn't take arguments or return a value or throw an exception. Implementations can do all those things, but they must do it within the call and use instance variables to store arguments, return value and exception.
        Specified by:
        execute in class ExecutableAssertion
